reviews_data.review_text: Great place to grab a sandwich. Their prepackaged salads and sides are amazing too. Wide selection of drinks and snacks. My office is in the are and this is a perfect lunch option.
The food is exceptional,  the atmosphere is awesome, the service is professional. I love Rhino's. My commitment is to visit each site.
Will had my food out promptly! Delicious!

This is the most watered down tomato bisque. I have ever over paid for in my entire life. Also, there was a bunch of people in their kitchen and they didn't call my number and I was like I think this is my soup and they're like OK you can take it and he stayed texting on his phone, didn't look up don't not have a care in the world lol I was like OK thank you..... and I had to like teach my hand into the kitchen Cubby hole thing he like refused to look up and hand it to me which was awk because there is like a table separating you from there area They normally set the food on the tables that you can grab it and then And put it on the spiky thing, but they told me to put it there and then they told me to reach into their kitchen and grab my own soup. I was like OK lol. It was really awkward. lol good has gone down hill and service is a joke. That sucks I really used to like that place.

Edit

The actual owner reached out to me when I left a message and corrected the staff and gave me a gift card. He told me that they were transitioning soups and they gave me the last of the soup and they shouldn't have any. He apologized for that as well as correcting his employees.

I really appreciate that because I was there for work and I used a little across the street and I was showing a coworker the spot and it really made me sad how I felt like the place was going downhill, but he assured me that he corrected the situation and he even went as far as to giving me a gift card and apologizing for the nasty soup and that speaks volumes to me and I really appreciate that so I will be visiting again And I am updating this review

I love this place but I have one note: PLEASESTOP PUTTING THE PRICE TAG DIRECTLY ON THE TABS OF BEER CANS. Nobody wants wet paper in their beer and placing the tag directly on the tab makes it really difficult to remove

Convenient locations which is how they get away with 200-500% markup on basic groceries and deli.

After years of leveraging Rhino Market for meals and place to work, I spent my last dollar today.  I ordered a breakfast online for a business meeting at 7:30 AM and requested the earliest time which was 9:00 assuming they would prepare it asap. I arrived at 8:15 and they had not started the breakfast so I told them when asked I would keep the order but I requested if they could "hustle" since I have a 9:00 scheduled meeting.  I had to bite my tongue when the guy with long hair behind the counter replied "ain't nobody hustling for you because you ordered this for 9 AM now pay for your order now"

As I mentioned after years of spending time and money here, this will be the last time I ever come back to a rhino market bc it took everything in me not to blow up on this guy.

A lunch staple! Seemingly impossible to pick a bad sandwich, my favorite is always the Hot Roast Beef. Paired with a bag of Voodoo chips and a local draft from the bar, and you're all set. Don't forget a hot sauce from the market on the way out!
Such a cute place! Cool place to get some wine and lunch!
Decent sandwiches' but $13 for 1 is silly.

We love Rhino Markets for a reasonably priced, quick meal. My wife and I enjoy the roast beef and Reuben sandwiches.
It's fun to browse the shop while waiting for the food to be prepared.

I would give this place 5 stars if it were not for the incredibly weak coffee. They have access to good beans but are stingy with the ratio of water to beans. The coffee ends up almost transparent which is a shame. The staff and service are top notch and super friendly. No snobby hipster service, just cool guys and girls that provide a friendly neighborhood vibe. Great selection of beers, great sandwiches. Please fix the coffee, it is unbearably weak.
Your want to try a great sandwich and an endless supply of craft beer... Look no further!!
Their Reuben is really good! It is about 10$

Rhino Market, South End, is conveniently located off of North Tryon street, right outside of Uptown, in the Railyard Building/Complex. It's connected to North Italia and STIR & is across the street from other great venues such as Gin Mill and Brickyard.

Food/Drinks:
Rhino Market provides fresh, locally sourced products including food, craft beer, wine, baked good, specialty coffee, hot sauces, chips and many other fabulous items. They have over 40 menu items including vegetarian and vegan options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. So, RM has excellent bites, a profound market and amazing coffee. RM has daily features Monday - Friday such as Wed - Top Sirloin French Dip and Fri - Mangia (roasted chicken, roasted red peppers, caramelized onions, sweet and spicy pickled peppers, italian sausage, provolone, arugula, basil all on a sesame roll. Don't forget to stop by Monday, Tuesday and/or Thursday for their other amazing specials.
Their menu also includes salads and specialty soups.

You can purchase beer, wine, kombucha, soda, sake, etc. and consume them on or off premises.

Atmosphere:
Rhino Market is stationed inside 'The Railyard' and has an inside market with seating, a bar, seating outside of the market (but still inside) and even seating outside so you can enjoy the weather. RM is also PET FRIENDLY. All of areas have access to high speed WIFI so you can definitely bring your work with you and enjoy some great food and beverages.

PRO TIPS:
(*) Weekend specials - $5 Mimosas on Saturday & Sunday at the Wesley Heights|South End|SouthPark locations.

(*) $3.50 beer - Thursday's at the South End location with up to TEN (10) selections of a premium selection of craft beers from local to nation-wide breweries across the country.

All in all, I am recommending Rhino Market you anyone that is reading this. You definitely will not be disappointed. For hours, just look up the location that is closest to you but all four (4) locations are equally awesome.

I have loved the Rhino Market since I was introduced to it. The coffee is the best on the SouthEnd and before this morning I would have said the same about the breakfast sandwiches. However, this morning a series of events showed me that I need to find a different place for food. Firstly, my order was taken by a young woman who obviously wanted to be anywhere else. Secondly, it took almost 9 minutes and 6 people being served their food before me when I had ordered before them. Thirdly, the white of the egg was literally dark brown and  very crispy. Four and final the long haired wanna-be hippie at the register decided I had taken the gross handling of my food personally, like the people in the kitchen were incompetent because it was me... Nope I said "whoever made this sandwich can have it, because I'm not going to eat it" He got even more indigent when I showed him and asked if he would want to eat it. HE caused the issue not me, and I even said that I phrased my statement so I would not be labeled as a "Karen". Which always is the case when an older white woman voices her dissatisfaction with service. Then he said he'd throw in the trash I said that was fine and he could keep my money.
I know they don't care that I will never enter this location again, I am but one person, but I've had my say and will be on my way. Wish I had taken a picture of the mess, but he knows what I'm talking about, he saw it. Have a good day hippie man.
Really nice market with an open space to relax and snack and drink. It seems appropriate for a remote working setup or casual stop.
There were missing items in my order and they did not offer to rectify the situation
Great sandwiches; quick service!  Drinks from refrigerated section a bit pricey at $4.99 each.  two sandwiches and two drinks with tip = $40.
Staff is great. Love it here

Cute little deli, bar, convenient store, lounge type situation. I loved being able to go in and grab a few mimosas and peach Bellinis on special on a Saturday/Sunday. Great idea. I felt nice afterwards lol thanks for a good time and there was a DJ present.

Hands down my top visited place in Charlotte (and I've lived here for 6 years)! My go to is the chicken torta sandwich, but there are so many good options. My husband and I have spent a lot of time hanging here getting lunch and doing work or relaxing. The atmosphere is great and I appreciate the kind employees!

Cool spot. I stopped in the by a bag of coffee and drink a beer. They have a pretty good selection of beers on tap. There's lot of seating in and outdoor. The staff is friendly.

It's in the middle of a plaza with restaurants and stores around it and apartments above. Google maps was trying to take me in through a door that only apartment residents had access too but it was easy to see where you're supposed to go.
The manager is rude and racist! She got all our cars booted on Friday and we were being charged 500.00 get the boots removed. Unacceptable!!!!
Good food and atmosphere

Great selection of drinks, including different Nitro coffee flavors, which I love! Got the beef sandwich from there, and it's also very good. The aura is very cool. There's indoor and outdoor seating (indoor section open air on nice days). It's part of the Railway Yard South End building, which has a lot of other cool stuff too.
Whoever is making the sandwiches does not care what you are eating. Just a heads up, I have received several sandwiches with toppings that look like compost. Got some tasty stems today, yum!

I enjoyed the atmosphere and food at this establishment. Prices were good, and the meal was plentiful. Neighborhood is okay, and you can find a place to park. Staff is attentive and caring. Would recommend them to whoever is in the South End of Charlotte-

Great food and good selection. Service is not restaurant like, but it's not really a restaurant so that is to be expected in a deli environment. Service was great overall, just don't expect to be waited on hand and foot.  Will return for the sandwiches alone when I'm in the area. Have enjoyed both the Italian and Roast Beef sandwiches
Great sandwiches, but their sweet tea is weak! They might as well have two pitchers labeled unsweet.
Had breakfast here, good eats and great iced coffee,  cool modern store.
great food and drinks
Great sandwiches
Could be better. Sandwich maker on a Saturday didn't seem happy. Cashier kiosk ipad, or whatever, always asks for a tip when none is warranted. They don't sell Gatorade.

We visited Rhino Market and we loved the sandwiches!!!  The staff is very friendly and the place is just fantastic.  Super Recommended !!

Visitamos Rhino Market y nos encantaron los sandwich!!! El personal es muy amable y el lugar simplemente fantastico. Super Recomendado !!

IG: @somosdosuniversos
The food here is amazing, love the breakfast burrito and chicken torta. Fast service and pleasant people.
Be careful.  Rhino can't keep up with back to office South End lunch crush.  Took a half hour! to get a sandwich. Love this place but won't go back until they get things straight.
Great local hot spot. Good food. Wonderful little shops.

I love rhino Market and Deli. The food is great, the atmosphere is cool, and the people are usually great! Usually... today I went to this location and everything just seemed off. The man who took our sandwich order said no words to us. Barely recognized we existed. The man whom I paid with was too busy reading things on his phone to hold a conversation. The second man I checked out with was at least kind enough to have a small chat with me. I dont always expect customer service workers to be the happiest people on earth, I just don't expect them to be so stand-offish. At least the food was delicious.
Great people and great place for sandwiches and beer/wine/snacks.
Quick Stop before your Midnight Drop
I'm a regular here!  Great breakfast and lunch.  Love the poppy aoli and garlic mayo on almost anything.  This location has a great lounge area.
This is one of my favorite lunch spots.  The food is really good and the staff is always very nice.  The seating inside and out is just phenomenal.  Definitely a fun place to grab some lunch!
Breakfast sandwiches are pretty darn tasty.  Breakfast menu has expanded!  And $3.50 beers on Thursdays....

I like this one, it's the best one of all of them.
However I do feel like I'm cheating on noda when I go.
Avocado BLT was great!

Love the location and the food is ok. I used to come here daily before work but stopped going as much recently. The customer service is lacking and I've heard the manager talk pretty nasty to some of the employees which makes me uncomfortable would be great if the environment wasn't so tense
Fun shop, had the daily special Reuben, I think I should have asked to have it heated up, and a lavender lemon kombucha which was tasty.

Bangin music but cashier was really nasty. I had come in earlier to ask did they have public restrooms because clearly we're still in a pandemic not every store is offering this. He made a smart remark saying "if they're locked that means somebody is in them." Then later came back to buy some drinks he checked me out then hit me with an "alright thank you" rushed me off no offer of a bag or receipt while the machine was still saying choose a tip. I asked for bag then Got a rude "alright thank you" then asked for a receipt "alright thank you" dude was a complete ahole for no reason my thing is sir if you dont like your job go get another. I also saw him coming towards the bathroom with his keys the first time i said i was going to the restroom (my guess is he thought I was stealing) when clearly i wasnt even in there bc both were locked he brushed past me I dont get what this guys deal was! Very rude and trust you can tell when someone has an attitude literally watched him check out the white patrons in front of me and he wasnt acting that way! Also in times of covid nobody wants your dirty bare hands all over the top of their drink.... WILL NOT BE COMING HERE AGAIN! Will definitely stick to the one near inner city beside duke energy building!
Great market place and they had vegan options
Clean & decent place to get a quick bite.
Great food.  Nice lunch atmosphere.
Finally a fantastic deli sandwich! Thank you.
Really cool spot for tea, coffee, sandwiches, and snacks. Plenty of seating on weekends, but can be crowded during the week. Big beer and wine selection.

I have power rankings for club sandwichs and Rhino market is by far THE BEST club sandwich in town. Best staff out there BY FAR!!!!!! in the past year i probably have averaged eating here around 5 times a week. Quick Affordable, tasty and friendly. If anyone has a problem with rhino take it up with me cuz you are very wrong
This place is very cool! No parking though! Be ready to Uber or walk
Yoooooo! This is my spot,reminds me of Katz in nyc..... shout out 2pplz sis tank u young lady..
Large ipa selection, a few stouts and other ales... not much of a lager selection.

My favorite Rhino Market yet. Very clean, organized, and open. Rhino Market's tend to be a little cramped, but not this one. The gentleman that helped us at the register was very knowledgeable about the different brews which was quite helpful. This location will definitely be a staple.
Love it though it is loud if you are trying to get work done

Really cool place with a great packaged beer selection, beer and cold brew on tap with bar seating, deli sandwiches, and a decent selection of candy, protein bars, wine, chips, and frozen food. The seating is great, the place is spacious and has outdoor seating, and the vibe is super chill. They have wifi too, so I might be coming here some days to do work.
